summary: This document contains psychological and medical observation reports for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 28-29, 2019. It details Epstein's complaints about sleep apnea, numbness in his arm and neck, and his request to remain in a 'safe' area rather than return to the SHU (Special Housing Unit). The psychologist notes he is psychologically stable but will be returned to SHU.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the medical and psychological observation reports, complaining of sleep apnea, numbness in his arm and neck, and requesting to stay in a 'safe' area rather than return to the SHU.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Another inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who is being taken off of Psych Observation, mentioned in the same facility log as Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's medical complaints and observation
events.description: Epstein complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet in his cell. He was seen by a nurse and deemed psychologically stable.

events.title: Epstein's request to delay SHU return
events.description: Epstein requested to remain in the 'safe' hospital area for one more night to use his CPAP machine for sleep apnea before returning to the SHU. The psychologist agreed to one more night but stated he must return to SHU the next day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
SHU (Special Housing Unit) at Metropolitan Correctional Center
SW/Hospital area at Metropolitan Correctional Center
keyFacts: On July 28-29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York and was scheduled to return to the SHU (Special Housing Unit).
Epstein complained of sleep apnea, numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
Epstein requested to remain in the 'safe' hospital area rather than return to the SHU, citing comfort and safety concerns, but was told he would be placed in a safe situation in the SHU.
A psychologist assessed Epstein as 'psychologically stable' and noted there were no mental health issues precluding his return to the SHU.
The document shows Epstein was concerned about his physical condition and environment in the days leading up to his death on August 10, 2019.
